Constructor Detail

DataBaseImpl

public DataBaseImpl(java.lang.String dbfilename,
                    java.lang.String magiccode)
             throws java.io.IOException
This is the only constructor. It validates the magiccode at the begining of the database file and then if valid, initializes the internal structures.

Parameters:
dbfilename - The full file name (including path) that stores the data.
magiccode - The magiccode that identifies the file as the file meant for a given application.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - This exception is thrown if there is a problem in reading/writing the db file or if the given magiccode does not match with the magiccode stored in the dbfile.

lock

public java.lang.String lock(int recNo)
                      throws RecordNotFoundException
Locks the record. If the record has been locked, it waits until it gets the lock. A client should not try to lock a record that it has already locked since it will lead to a deadlock. This method does not attempt to check or prevent deadlock arising because of multiple client requesting locks in cyclic pattern. For example, let's say Client A holds lock for Rec3 and Client B hold lock for Rec 5. Now, if Client A requests lock for Rec 5 and Client B requests lock for Rec 3, there will be a deadlock. In general, locking is done by the application and so deadlock problem should be taken care of by the application and not by the database. The Database has no knowledge of who is requesting the lock for what reason. Application code knows that and is thus better prepared to prevent deadlocks.

Specified by:
lock in interface DataBase
Parameters:
recNo -
Returns:
The lock key.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException

unlock

public void unlock(int recNo,
                   java.lang.String lockkey)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   SecurityException
Unlocks the record.

Specified by:
unlock in interface DataBase
Parameters:
recNo - Record to be unlocked. -1 implies unlock the database.
lockkey - The record (or the database) should have been locked using this key.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - Thrown if there is no record by this record number.
java.lang.SecurityException - Thrown if the lockkey does not match the key with which the record was locked.
SecurityException

lockWithoutCookie

public void lockWithoutCookie(int recNo)
                       throws RecordNotFoundException
This method is similar to lock() method except that it does not return lock cookie. This method assumes that the client that holds the lock is the one that tries to unlock it. The remote layer (RMIUCServer or SocketUCServer) implements the mechanism that ensures that only the client that holds the lock is able to unlock it.

Specified by:
lockWithoutCookie in interface DataBase
Parameters:
recNo -
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException

unlockWithoutCookie

public void unlockWithoutCookie(int recNo)
                         throws RecordNotFoundException
This method is similar to unlock() method except that it does not take lock cookie parameter. This method assumes that the client that holds the lock is the one that tries to unlock it. The remote layer (RMIUCServer or SocketUCServer) implements the mechanism that ensures that only the client that holds the lock is able to unlock it.

Specified by:
unlockWithoutCookie in interface DataBase
Parameters:
recNo - Record to be unlocked. -1 implies unlock the database.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - Thrown if there is no record by this record number.
